title: Adopt enforced task-start and task-end provenance artifacts for Cursor agents
problem: Agent task completions were not consistently producing machine-verifiable provenance artifacts and risk flags.
options: Rely on prompt instructions only with no hard checks
Use rules and manual review with no automated hooks
Use a bundled rules + hooks + schema + CI enforcement approach
outcome: Adopt a provenance enforcement bundle that requires task-start review artifacts, task-end provenance objects, schema validation, and CI checks.
rationale: Combining runtime hooks with schema validation and CI provides fail-closed behavior and auditable outputs while still allowing optional hard-fail controls for unresolved high-risk items.

risk.description: Strict enforcement can block delivery if hooks are misconfigured or risk logs are incomplete.
mitigations: Provide documented bundle setup and local simulation scripts
Validate artifacts in CI with explicit error messages
Allow staged rollout with optional hard-fail toggle
